tags.name: cases
tags.description: Case APIs enable you to open and track issues.

tags.name: kibana
tags.description: Kibana APIs enable you to interact with Kibana features.

post.description: Creates a case. You must have all privileges for the **Cases** feature in the **Management**, **Observability**, or **Security** section of the Kibana feature privileges, depending on the owner of the case you're creating.

connector.description: An object that contains the connector configuration.

fields.description: An object containing the connector fields. To create a case without a connector, specify null. If you want to omit any individual field, specify null as its value.

caseId.description: The case identifier for Swimlane connectors.

category.description: The category of the incident for ServiceNow ITSM and ServiceNow SecOps connectors.

destIp.description: A comma-separated list of destination IPs for ServiceNow SecOps connectors.

impact.description: The effect an incident had on business for ServiceNow ITSM connectors.

issueType.description: The type of issue for Jira connectors.

issueTypes.description: The type of incident for IBM Resilient connectors.

malwareHash.description: A comma-separated list of malware hashes for ServiceNow SecOps connectors.

malwareUrl.description: A comma-separated list of malware URLs for ServiceNow SecOps connectors.

parent.description: The key of the parent issue, when the issue type is sub-task for Jira connectors.

priority.description: The priority of the issue for Jira and ServiceNow SecOps connectors.

severity.description: The severity of the incident for ServiceNow ITSM connectors.

severityCode.description: The severity code of the incident for IBM Resilient connectors.

sourceIp.description: A comma-separated list of source IPs for ServiceNow SecOps connectors.

subcategory.description: The subcategory of the incident for ServiceNow ITSM connectors.

urgency.description: The extent to which the incident resolution can be delayed for ServiceNow ITSM connectors.

id.description: The identifier for the connector. To create a case without a connector, use `none`.

name.description: The name of the connector. To create a case without a connector, use `none`.

settings.description: An object that contains the case settings.

syncAlerts.description: Turns alert syncing on or off.

tags.description: The words and phrases that help categorize cases. It can be an empty array.

fields.description: An object containing the connector fields. To create a case without a connector, specify null. If you want to omit any individual field, specify null as its value.

caseId.description: The case identifier for Swimlane connectors.

category.description: The category of the incident for ServiceNow ITSM and ServiceNow SecOps connectors.

destIp.description: A comma-separated list of destination IPs for ServiceNow SecOps connectors.

impact.description: The effect an incident had on business for ServiceNow ITSM connectors.

issueType.description: The type of issue for Jira connectors.

issueTypes.description: The type of incident for IBM Resilient connectors.

malwareHash.description: A comma-separated list of malware hashes for ServiceNow SecOps connectors.

malwareUrl.description: A comma-separated list of malware URLs for ServiceNow SecOps connectors.

parent.description: The key of the parent issue, when the issue type is sub-task for Jira connectors.

priority.description: The priority of the issue for Jira and ServiceNow SecOps connectors.

severity.description: The severity of the incident for ServiceNow ITSM connectors.

severityCode.description: The severity code of the incident for IBM Resilient connectors.

sourceIp.description: A comma-separated list of source IPs for ServiceNow SecOps connectors.

subcategory.description: The subcategory of the incident for ServiceNow ITSM connectors.

urgency.description: The extent to which the incident resolution can be delayed for ServiceNow ITSM connectors.

id.description: The identifier for the connector. To create a case without a connector, use `none`.

name.description: The name of the connector. To create a case without a connector, use `none`.

description.example: James Bond clicked on a highly suspicious email banner advertising cheap holidays for underpaid civil servants. Operation bubblegum is active. Repeat - operation bubblegum is now active

duration.description: The elapsed time from the creation of the case to its closure (in seconds). If the case has not been closed, the duration is set to null.

title.example: This case will self-destruct in 5 seconds

delete.description: Deletes one or more cases. You must have all privileges for the **Cases** feature in the **Management**, **Observability**, or **Security** section of the Kibana feature privileges, depending on the owner of the cases you're deleting.

parameters.name: ids
parameters.description: The cases that you want to removed. To retrieve case IDs, use the find cases API. All non-ASCII characters must be URL encoded.

patch.description: Updates one or more cases. You must have all privileges for the **Cases** feature in the **Management**, **Observability**, or **Security** section of the Kibana feature privileges, depending on the owner of the case you're updating.

create_case_request.summary: Create a security case that uses a Jira connector.

value.description: James Bond clicked on a highly suspicious email banner advertising cheap holidays for underpaid civil servants.
value.title: This case will self-destruct in 5 seconds

create_case_response.summary: The create case API returns a JSON object that includes the user who created the case and the case identifier, version, and creation time.

value.title: This case will self-destruct in 5 seconds
value.description: James Bond clicked on a highly suspicious email banner advertising cheap holidays for underpaid civil servants. Operation bubblegum is active. Repeat - operation bubblegum is now active

update_case_request.summary: Update the case description, tags, and connector.

cases.description: James Bond clicked on a highly suspicious email banner advertising cheap holidays for underpaid civil servants. Operation bubblegum is active. Repeat - operation bubblegum is now active!

update_case_response.summary: This is an example response when the case description, tags, and connector were updated.

value.title: This case will self-destruct in 5 seconds
value.description: James Bond clicked on a highly suspicious email banner advertising cheap holidays for underpaid civil servants. Operation bubblegum is active. Repeat - operation bubblegum is now active!
